case_study.name: Case Study Methodology
case_study.purpose: Provide in-depth understanding of real-world phenomena within their natural context

philosophical_foundations.epistemology: Constructivist - knowledge constructed through interaction between researcher and context
philosophical_foundations.ontology: Relativist - reality is context-dependent and socially constructed

phase_1_case_selection.description: Strategic selection of cases for investigation

phase_2_data_collection.description: Collect multiple forms of evidence from selected cases

phase_3_within_case_analysis.description: Analyze data within each individual case

phase_4_cross_case_analysis.description: Compare patterns and insights across multiple cases

phase_5_theory_building.description: Build theoretical understanding from case evidence

pattern_matching.description: Compare observed patterns with predicted patterns

strengths_for_protocol_research: Provides real-world context for protocol usage and adaptation

application_to_acp_a2a.case_selection: Select 1-2 DER organizations actively using communication protocols

action_research.name: Action Research Methodology
action_research.purpose: Methodology involving stakeholders in identifying problems and developing solutions collaboratively.
strengths_for_protocol_research: High practical relevance and stakeholder buy-in
limitations_considerations: Requires significant stakeholder commitment and time
Can be difficult to control scope

timeline_breakdown.total_duration: Variable, often long-term (16-24 weeks for a cycle)

living_lab.name: Living Lab Methodology
living_lab.purpose: Test innovations in real-world settings with active stakeholder participation.
strengths_for_protocol_research: Identified as relevant in literature for qualitative aspects

participatory_design.name: Participatory Design
participatory_design.purpose: Involving all stakeholders in the design process.
strengths_for_protocol_research: Identified as relevant in literature for qualitative aspects

grounded_theory.name: Grounded Theory Methodology
grounded_theory.purpose: Generate theory grounded in systematically collected and analyzed data
strengths_for_protocol_research: Generates novel theoretical insights about protocol adaptation
limitations_considerations: May not align well with technical protocol research objectives

ethnography.name: Ethnography
ethnography.purpose: Studying people in their own environment to understand their culture, behaviors, and social structures.
strengths_for_protocol_research: Rich contextual understanding of protocol use in situ
Can uncover tacit knowledge and informal practices
limitations_considerations: Typically long-term and immersive, challenging for short thesis

timeline_breakdown.total_duration: Often 6+ months, can be adapted for shorter exploratory studies

content_analysis.name: Content Analysis (Qualitative)
content_analysis.purpose: Systematically analyzing the content of communications to identify patterns, themes, biases, and meanings.
strengths_for_protocol_research: Useful for analyzing protocol documentation, communication logs, or stakeholder feedback
limitations_considerations: Interpretation can be subjective if not rigorously applied

timeline_breakdown.total_duration: Good, can be efficient depending on data volume
